main event: On March 27, 1949, multiple observers reported seeing a long and narrow, self-luminous aerial object over Tucumcari, New Mexico.
interesting points: The observed object was described as having an amber color and was compared in size to known objects, appearing long and narrow; each witness saw the object for an extended period of 15 to 25 minutes., Several witnesses confirmed the object's flight path was from east to west at an altitude of approximately 90 degrees above the horizon., Multiple reports came from various locations in Tucumcari, with at least one observer being an editor associated with the local newspaper., The object was reported to fade out in the distance without any noticeable trail or sound., Information regarding similar sightings was compiled, and this report was part of an ongoing investigation by the U.S. Air Force's Office of Special Investigations.
sighted object: a long and narrow, self-luminous aerial object
witness description: Various observers including a police officer and an editor from the local newspaper.
